ul.li1: 1Oh my!Literally “Behold!” Or “Look!” You are beautiful, my beloved!
ul.li2: Oh my!Literally “Behold!” Or “Look!” You are beautiful!
ul.li1: Your eyes are doves
ul.li2: from behind your veil.
ul.li1: Your hair is like a flock of goats
ul.li2: that move down from the mountains of Gilead.
ul.li1: 2Your teeth are like a flock of shorn ewes
ul.li2: that came up from the washing,
ul.li1: all of them bearing twins,
ul.li2: and there is none bereaved among them.
ul.li1: 3Your lips are like a thread of crimson,
ul.li2: and your mouth is lovely.
ul.li1: Your temple is like pomegranate
ul.li2: from behind your veil.
ul.li1: 4Your neck is like the tower of David,
ul.li2: built in courses;
ul.li1: a thousand ornamentsLiterally “shields” are hung on it,
ul.li2: all the shields of the warriors.
ul.li1: 5Your two breasts are like two fawns,
ul.li2: twins of a gazelle that feed among the lilies.
ul.li1: 6Until the day breathes and the shadows flee,
ul.li2: I will go to the mountain of the myrrh,
ul.li3: to the hill of the frankincense.
ul.li1: 7You are completely beautiful, my beloved!
ul.li2: You are flawless!Literally “There is no flaw in you!”

chapter.pericope: The Mountains and Fragrance of Lebanon

ul.li1: 8ComeOr “You must come” with me from Lebanon, my bride!
ul.li2: Come with meOr “With me” from Lebanon!
ul.li1: Look from the top of Amana,
ul.li2: from the top of Senir and Hermon,
ul.li1: from the dwelling places of the lions,
ul.li2: from the mountains of leopard.
ul.li1: 9You have stolen (my) heart, my sister bride!
ul.li2: You have stolen my heart with one glance from your eyes,
ul.li3: with one ornament from your necklaces.
ul.li1: 10How beautiful is your love, my sister bride!
ul.li2: How better is your love than wine,
ul.li3: and the fragrance of your oils than any spice!
ul.li1: 11Your lips drip nectar, my bride;
ul.li2: honey and milk are under your lips;
ul.li3: the scent of your garments is like the scent of Lebanon.

chapter.pericope: The Locked Garden of Delights Is Unlocked

ul.li1: 12A garden locked is my sister bride,
ul.li2: a spring enclosed,Or “a source locked” a fountain sealed.
ul.li1: 13Your shootsOr “your channel” are an orchard of pomegranates with choice fruit,Literally “fruit of choice things”
ul.li2: henna with nard;
ul.li1: 14nard and saffron, calamus and cinnamon spice with all trees of frankincense,
ul.li2: myrrh and aloes with all chief spices.
ul.li1: 15A garden fountain, a well of living water,
ul.li2: flowing (streams) from Lebanon.
ul.li1: 16Awake, O north wind! Come, O south wind!
ul.li2: Blow upon my garden! Let its fragrancesOr “perfumes” waft forth!Or “His perfumes can waft down”
ul.li1: Let my beloved come to his garden,
ul.li2: let him eat his choice fruit!
